statement.p: Recall that the lift equation is \displaystyle{L}=\frac{{1}}{{2}}\rho{s}{C}_{{L}}{v}^{{2}}.
Suppose \displaystyle\rho={0.001956}, \displaystyle{s}={193}, and \displaystyle{C}_{{L}}={1.33}. How much does the lift increase if velocity is increased from 56.3 nm/hr to 75.2 nm/hr?

solution.p: The velocity units are in nautical miles per hour which does not match the other units. First, we need to convert.
Now we can use the lift equation
Thus an increase in 18.9 nm/hr results in an increase of \displaystyle{4044.0267047362}-{2266.7056299752}={1777.3210747609}\approx{1780} lbs.
